body:
Thanks for raising this -- we looked at a few DLC versions (2.2rc2 and 2.2.0.1) and cannot reproduce the result, e.g.: 
![Effnet0](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20850270/133498366-eccb0cc0-dfe0-4771-80bd-278c15f188d1.png). Can you give more details on the model, & how it was trained?

[indeed 2.2 "appears" to as 2.2rc3?, as we forgot to update [__version__](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/de70db283f8bec32acd6cd01520db0626fa33382/deeplabcut/version.py)]

Hey, thanks for the prompt replies!

I remember that I read that it might have something to do with cropping? But I tested with true and false in the config.yaml

I attached my train.py file (I deleted the non effnets models down below). I generally train with a 90/10 split but the rest are default parameters. Only the ones are changed that are specified in the train script. Could you maybe run it and see if it produces the same offset results? Maybe with less shuffles and iterations (shuffle=1 and max_iteration=10000 should be enough to see if you run into the same problems, maybe even less)

Currently, I am having problems with tensorflow and out-of-memory errors. Do you think that you also be related to a DLC bug? It suddenly occurred a few days ago after upgrading to 2.2.1, so I thought that this might be related? If yes, I can open a new issue for this.

@MMathisLab I will test check_labels soon and let you know!

P.S. On the cluster (where the offset occurred) I am using CentOS7 (Ubuntu 18.04 is my working station). Sorry about the mixup but it shouldnt change anything.

__________train.py
```
import deeplabcut as dlc
import math
import yaml
import io
import time

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

#set project_path
project_path= #add your project path here and run code
config_path=project_path+'config.yaml'

#set parameters
shuffles=3
max_iteration=50000
max_saved_snapshots=math.ceil(max_iteration/10000) #should save every 10.000 iteration + last one if not integer
images_scmap_PAF_locref=[0, 2, 5, 8, 10]

#define models
models={'model1': 
            {'iteration': 9,
             'default_net_type': 'efficientnet-b2',
             'default_augmenter': 'multi-animal-imgaug',
             'batch_size': 4
            },
	'model3':
            {'iteration': 11,
             'default_net_type': 'efficientnet-b6',
             'default_augmenter': 'tensorpack',
             'batch_size': 1
            },
	'model4':
            {'iteration': 12,
             'default_net_type': 'efficientnet-b4',
             'default_augmenter': 'tensorpack',
             'batch_size': 1
            },
	'model8':
            {'iteration': 16,
             'default_net_type': 'efficientnet-b2',
             'default_augmenter': 'multi-animal-imgaug',
             'batch_size': 8
            },
	'model9':
            {'iteration': 17,
             'default_net_type': 'efficientnet-b6',
             'default_augmenter': 'multi-animal-imgaug',
             'batch_size': 8
            }
        }

total_time_all={}

for i in models:
    model=models[i]

    start=time.time()
    print(model)
  
    #update config_file with model to train next
    dlc.auxiliaryfunctions.edit_config(config_path, model)
    
    #set net_type variable for model
    net_type=models[i].get('default_net_type')
    
    dlc.create_multianimaltraining_dataset(config_path, 
                                           num_shuffles=shuffles, 
                                           crop_size=(400, 400), 
                                           crop_sampling='keypoints', 
                                           net_type=net_type)
    
    #for resnet 101 or even 152 set intermediate_supervision=true in pose_config.yaml

    if net_type=='resnet_101' or net_type=='resnet_152':
        
        with open("config.yaml", 'r') as stream:
            config_loaded = yaml.safe_load(stream)

        for j in range(1, shuffles+1):
            s=str(j)
            pose_config_path=project_path+'dlc-models/iteration-'+str(models[i].get('iteration'))+'/'+config_loaded.get('Task')+config_loaded.get('date')+'-trainset'+str(int(config_loaded.get('TrainingFraction')[0]*100))+'shuffle'+s+'/train/pose_cfg.yaml'
            print(pose_config_path)
            params={'intermediate_supervision':True}
            dlc.auxiliaryfunctions.edit_config(pose_config_path, params)
        
        print('intermediate_supervision=true is changed in pose_config.yaml')
            
    for i in range(1, shuffles+1):
        dlc.train_network(config_path, shuffle=i, maxiters=max_iteration, max_snapshots_to_keep=max_saved_snapshots)
        dlc.extract_save_all_maps(config_path, shuffle=i, Indices=images_scmap_PAF_locref)
                                  
    dlc.evaluate_network(config_path, Shuffles=list(range(1,shuffles+1)), plotting=True)

    end=time.time()
    
    total_time=(end-start)/60/60

    print(model)
    print(total_time)

    total_time_all[i] = total_time

with open('training_times.txt', 'w') as f:
    print(total_time_all, file=f)




```

@MMathisLab I did the check labels step but there the label are on point :)

![check_labels](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39856231/133795139-dd4f7178-2a24-4a81-9b98-41c2ce8d22c7.png)

I was rerunning some models but same results. I change the cropping parameters again in the config.yaml:
1)
cropping: true
croppedtraining: true
2)
cropping: false
croppedtraining: false

the dlcrnet_ms5 and resnet101 model looks fine!

Any more ideas? I checked out the link with the solution but as I said, the check_labels look perfect (see above).

I appreciate any support and ideas that I can test!:)

@AnFrBo as an aside, EffNets are very finicky, and need quite a bit of hyperparameter optimization, in contrast to ResNets and DLCRNet - please see our work on them here: http://www.mackenziemathislab.org/horse10

To clarify @MMathisLab statements -- they are finicky in the sense that good learning schedules are less consistent across datasets and parameters are less robust than for ResNets. But if tuned well, they typically give us better results. 

Anyway, they should not give a **12pixel offsets!** . For the 3 mouse case, this are the default parameters. Same is true for other datasets we looked at.

@AnFrBo couple things. One, you are not benhcmarking networks here appropriately, if that is what you indeed. You should use the same data split to do so; i.e.,check out `...model_comparison` in the repo. 

two, why are you using ` "keypoints" (randomly over the annotated keypoints),` vs. the recommended hybrid cropping approach? this has been extensively tested in our hands (see Lauer et al for the datsets)?


> Currently, I am having problems with tensorflow and out-of-memory errors. Do you think that you also be related to a DLC bug? It suddenly occurred a few days ago after upgrading to 2.2.1, so I thought that this might be related? If yes, I can open a new issue for this.

no, this is not a bug - here are many reasons for this, but as as you can see DLC is passing all unit tests. searching for the error message in the repo will yield a number of issues/suggestions on this. Hope that helps. 

I don't have the resources or time to run your training script, sorry; but I can ask for you to use the defaults we suggest first, since you change many things in your sweep, and also please see www.horse10.deeplabcut.org for how we to set the learning rates for EfficientNets

@MMathisLab, thanks again for the reply!:)

I checked out the model comparison function before, but since there were a few options missing (e.g. crop method and size) and I thought that it is not useable with the dlcrnet etc. because the explanation is an older one, I thought that I am better off with the other create_multiple_trainingsets function. My purpose was to get a feeling of the different performances and I thought it might be enough to check if the training/testing sets are similar to compare the models approx. But you are right, I cannot really compare the models like that. Changed it now and I can still access the yaml file by loading them in the script and automatically changing the parameter in there. 

Regarding the cropping approach. I didnt get the expected results with hybrid and then changed the cropping to keypoints and before density. The reason why is that there is a lot space where no fish aka no keypoints are. I worried that applying hybrid (which contains uniform cropping) might lead to too many crops without any data and is overrepresented. But I will test with hybrid again.

The tensorflow error was caused by a overloaded cluster, I think. Everything works now. Sorry!

I will wait to see if/how the performance of the efficientnets is influenced by the new settings and then check out the tuning!

Thanks again for your helpful comments! It is very appreciated:). Have a great Monday!
